title: Please ID These Two Serif Fonts
content:
I’m stumped. The font identifier on fonts.com is stumped. Help!

Sample A:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015011608im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sample3_6094.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015011608im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sample2_6244.jpg)

My first thought was Trajan Pro or LaGioconda, but neither of those fit. Trajan Pro is very close, but the lower right serif on the capital A does not extend at all to the right in the sample. The font in the sample also appears to be squarer in its proportions.

Sample B:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015011608im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sample1_4412.jpg)

I hope I'm not missing something obvious on this one. I thought maybe in the Garamond family, but nope.

Thanks!
author: Ed_Aranda

comments.content:
The top is Trajan, squooshed a bit.

The bottom looks like Garamond (Premier Pro?), squoosed a bit.
Thanks! It seems the “squooshed-ness” was leading me off-track.
